text: Richard John "Dick" McAuliffe (November 29, 1939 - May 13, 2016) was an American professional baseball player. He played in Major League Baseball as a shortstop and second baseman for the Detroit Tigers from 1960 to 1973 and for the Boston Red Sox from 1974 to 1975. He was born in Hartford, Connecticut. McAuliffe died on May 13, 2016 in Farmington, Connecticut after suffering a stroke and Alzheimer's disease, aged 76. ==References== Category:1939 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Boston Red Sox players Category:Deaths from stroke Category:Detroit Tigers players Category:People with Alzheimer's disease Category:Sportspeople from Hartford, Connecticut
title: Dick McAuliffe
